intro: Licaria dolichantha, commonly known as the long-stalked licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a hairy surface that aids in water retention. Licaria dolichantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
